svg.text: Stripboard Layouts for ML-303 Interface Circuits
1. Cut copper tracks: Between IC pins (rows D-E), isolate power rails
2. Components: 6N138 (DIP-8) at D6-E9, 220Ω resistors at B4, B5, 4.7kΩ at B11
3. Power: +5V rail at row B, GND rail at row H
4. I/O: MIDI DIN pins to A3, A4; Arduino A4 from F9; Power from A2, H2
1. Cut tracks: Between IC pins, isolate input/output
2. Components: CD4049 (DIP-14) at D3-E10, 0.1µF input cap, 100kΩ level pot
3. Power: ±15V rails or single +9V supply (see schematic for options)
4. Connections: Audio in/out, jumper between Pin 2→Pin 5 for cascade
1. Cut tracks: Isolate IC pins, separate SPI lines
2. Components: MCP4921 (DIP-14) at E6-F12, bypass capacitors recommended
3. Power: +5V rail, GND rail, tie LDAC to GND for immediate updates
4. SPI: CS, SCK, MOSI from Arduino; CV output buffer optional but recommended
• Use IC sockets for all ICs to prevent heat damage during soldering
• Cut tracks with a 3mm drill bit or track cutting tool
• Test continuity after cutting tracks to ensure proper isolation
• Use solid core wire for connections, keep leads short to minimize noise
